intro: Pometia pinnata, commonly known as the white mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Combretaceae. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in coastal areas, particularly in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has smooth, grayish bark and elongated, opposite leaves that are usually light green in color. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in hue, and it produces woody capsules as fruit. The plant plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
